Aggregation Class Reference

this class aggregates the packets received from the application layer and separates packet emissions by a time InterPacketDelay. More...

#include <Aggregation.h>

Inherits BaseLayer.

Detailed Description

this class aggregates the packets received from the application layer and separates packet emissions by a time InterPacketDelay.

Definition at line 39 of file Aggregation.h.

Member Function Documentation

void Aggregation::handleUpperMsg ( cMessage *  msg  )  [protected, virtual]

Handle messages from upper layer.

This function is pure virtual here, because there is no reasonable guess what to do with it by default.

Implements BaseLayer.

Definition at line 53 of file Aggregation.cc.

References BaseLayer::sendDown().

00053                                               {
00054   ApplPkt* pkt = check_and_cast<ApplPkt*> (msg);
00055   if (interPacketDelay == 0) {
00056     sendDown(msg);
00057   } else {
00058     const LAddress::L3Type& dest = pkt->getDestAddr();
00059     if (!isOkToSendNow(dest)) {
00060       // store packet
00061       destInfos[dest].second.push_back(pkt);
00062       // reschedule aggregation timer to "earliest destination"
00063       simtime_t destTxTime = destInfos[dest].first + interPacketDelay;
00064       if (aggregationTimer->isScheduled()) {
00065         if (aggregationTimer->getArrivalTime() > destTxTime) {
00066           cancelEvent( aggregationTimer);
00067           scheduleAt(destTxTime, aggregationTimer);
00068         }
00069       } else {
00070         scheduleAt(destTxTime, aggregationTimer);
00071       }
00072     } else {
00073       // send now
00074       destInfos[dest].second.push_back(pkt);
00075       sendAggregatedPacketNow(dest);
00076     }
00077   }
00078 }

void Aggregation::initialize ( int  stage  )  [virtual]

Initialization of the module and some variables.

First we have to initialize the module from which we derived ours, in this case BaseModule. This module takes care of the gate initialization.

Reimplemented from BaseLayer.
